articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The de minimis exemption, for items valued at up to $800 and sent from China via postal services, were previously able to enter the United States duty free and with minimal inspections.
articles.title: US to cut 'de minimis' tariff on China shipments, bolsters broader trade truce

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Pesha Magid
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump will arrive in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday morning to kick off a four-day swing through the Gulf region, a trip that will focus more on economic deals than on the security crises besetting the region, from the war in Gaza to the threat of escalation over Iran's nuclear program.
articles.title: Trump starts Gulf visit seeking big economic deals

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. and European diplomats went on a flurry of calls in the hours after U.S. President Donald Trump offered on Monday to join prospective Ukraine-Russia talks later this week, trying to find a path that would bring an end to the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Rush of diplomatic calls follow Trump's offer to join potential Russia-Ukraine talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The responsibility of tackling the fentanyl issue in the United States lies within the U.S. itself, China's foreign ministry said on Tuesday, rejecting the punitive tariffs Washington imposed on Beijing for not stemming the inflow.
articles.title: China says fentanyl issue is responsibility of the United States

articles.author: Jihoon Lee
articles.description: Asia-Pacific trade envoys will gather this week in South Korea for discussions on multilateral cooperation, with talks taking place at a time when countries are scrambling to respond to U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs.
articles.title: Asia Pacific trade envoys to discuss multilateral cooperation in tariff era

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: One of President Donald Trump's most contentious policies - his attempt to restrict automatic birthright citizenship - arrives at the U.S. Supreme Court this week with an unusual twist: The justices may focus on something else entirely.
articles.title: In birthright citizenship case, US Supreme Court gets two controversies in one

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: The arrest of a Wisconsin state court judge for allegedly helping a migrant evade U.S. authorities marks another salvo in a long-brewing debate about the presence of immigration agents in local courthouses.
articles.title: Trump administration's arrest of judge stirs debate over immigration courthouse arrests

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was sworn in for a second term on Tuesday, alongside his ministers, after a landslide win at a national election he said had returned the largest centre-left Labor government since federation in 1901.
articles.title: Australia's Albanese Labor government sworn in for second term

articles.author: Eduardo Baptista, Joe Cash, Liz Lee
articles.description: President Xi Jinping vowed on Tuesday to boost China's footprint in Latin America and the Caribbean with a new $9 billion credit line and fresh infrastructure investment, although Brazil warned the region not to become overly reliant on foreign funding.
articles.title: China offers Latin America and the Caribbean billions in bid to rival US influence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Romania's hard-right nationalist George Simion and centrist Bucharest mayor Nicusor Dan are neck-and-neck ahead of a May 18 presidential run-off that could have far-reaching consequences for the European Union, an opinion poll suggested on Tuesday.
articles.title: Poll shows Romanian hard-right and centrist candidates tied ahead of run-off
